text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the fire report being 'sufficient and suitable' is the responsibility of the owner even if the report was incorrectly completed by the third-party inspector. The candidate answer explicitly states this under Section 2.1 (Fire Risk Assessment): 'Delegation does not absolve responsibility. Under Article 9(1), the duty to carry out a suitable and sufficient fire risk assessment rests on the responsible person, not on any third party they engage. You cannot transfer your statutory duty by outsourcing the assessment.' This directly addresses the core requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "96af97b1-4044-42bb-9b71-15102a04a27e"}
